title: Steininger 2016 Riesling (Österreichischer Sekt)
description: Very exuberant bubbles burst to send notes of lime zest and lemon to the surface. There is real body and substance to this, more perhaps than one would bargain for in a Sekt, but there is impeccable balance. The finish is dry and fresh.

title: Tenuta delle Terre Nere 2017 Bianco  (Etna)
description: Aromas of acacia, chamomile and mature lemon zest slowly appear in the glass. The aromas carry through to the medium-bodied palate along with ripe yellow apple, hazelnut and a hint of flint. Tangy acidity lifts the dry finish.

title: Terra Costantino 2014 Rosso Contrada Blandano  (Etna)
description: Made with organically cultivated grapes, this opens with an enticing fragrance of Mediterranean scrub, wild mint, fragrant blue flower and woodland berry. The minty note follows over to the fresh, linear palate together with crushed strawberry, sour cherry and mint. It's polished, with lithe tannins and bright acidity. Drink through 2022.

title: Thick Skinned 2015 Red (Red Mountain)
description: This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (60%), Malbec (33%) and Petit Verdot. It's aromatically locked up on first pour, showing whiffs of cherry and spice. The palate is considerably more expressive, packed with rich, dense, jammy black cherry flavors surrounded by a pleasing sense of structure.

title: Tornatore 2017 Bianco  (Etna)
description: Inviting aromas of fragrant wildflower, white stone fruit, aromatic herb and a whiff of wet stone take center stage. On the linear, savory palate, bright acidity lifts ripe yellow apple, green melon, citrus zest and dried thyme, while a mineral note gives it a savory—almost salty—finish.

title: True Myth 2016 Paragon Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This widely available wine is a solid catch and stands out with its beautiful packaging. It offers a smoky nose that's complemented by lemon peel and sandalwood. Oak shows prominently on the palate, where smoked peach, melon and more lemon ride a creamy texture.

title: Ulithorne 2015 Avitus Shiraz (McLaren Vale)
description: This is classic South Aussie Shiraz: Ripe plums, chocolate, ground black pepper and a dusty, wood spice lead the way on the nose. The palate is full and plush, the tannins are fine-grained and focused and the oak is in check. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Winery by the Creek 2015 Estate Reserve Merlot (Fair Play)
description: This is a big, structured, full-bodied Merlot that feels moderately tannic in texture and gushes with ripe plum and black-cherry flavors. A light minty aroma and attractive oak spices work well to add complexity.

title: Yalumba 2014 The Scribbler Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz (Barossa)
description: A blend of 64% Cabernet Sauvignon and 36% Shiraz, this solidly made, full-boded red offers notes of plump cherry, plum, licorice, cocoa powder and dried green herbs. The herbaceouness really shines on the palate, supported by dusty tannins.

title: Keuka Spring 2017 Gewürztraminer (Finger Lakes)
description: A fragrant perfume of rose petals, melon, ginger and white pepper spice comes together in the glass. Succulent in feel, the palate is broad and oily, with supportive acidity and mild astringency maintaining balance. Flavors of juicy yellow apple, melon and spiced potpourri broaden the midpalate and lead to a delicate jasmine note on the lingering finish.

title: Colosi 2014 Passito di Salina  (Malvasia delle Lipari)
description: Made with Malvasia delle Lipari and a drop of Corinto grapes, this opens with aromas of dried apricot, ripe fig and a whiff of jasmine. The aromas carry over to the palate along with tangerine zest and star anise. It's sweet but well balanced.

title: Torricino 2014 Cevotiempo  (Taurasi)
description: Aromas suggesting pipe tobacco, blue flower, menthol, baked plum and a whiff of exotic spice take center stage. On the full-bodied, enveloping palate, firm, fine-grained tannins wrap around mature Morello cherry, licorice, prune and clove. Drink 2021–2029.

title: Acumen 2014 Peak Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: This estate-grown wine is brawny in leather, earth and cedar, with powerfully concentrated flavors of red currant and black cherry. Substantial in style, it resolves on the midpalate to show touches of acid-tinged grace and restraint. Its finish is sticky in dark chocolate.

title: Acumen 2014 Peak Edcora Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: Winemaker Henrik Poulsen worked alongside the late Denis Malbec on this winery project, which is relatively new to the appellation. Deep brambly berry aromas rise from the glass in this elegant effort, blended with tiny additions of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Brown-sugar flavors accent a velvety rich and smooth texture, the tannins tamed and softened.

title: Ada Nada 2015 Rombone Elisa  (Barbaresco)
description: Aromas of dark berry, underbrush and cooking spice appear in the glass. The savory palate offers dried black cherry, tobacco and star anise alongside polished tannins and firm acidity. Drink 2021–2028.

title: Alexana 2016 Revana Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: A diverse clonal mix adds texture and detail to this estate-grown wine. The fruit is a bit on the lean side, with flavors of red currant and wild raspberries. The tannins carry an earthy, herbal tone on through the extended finish. The best drinking window should be 2022 to 2030.

title: Bellangelo 2015 1866 Reserve Chardonnay (Seneca Lake)
description: Initially closed on the nose in tones of smoke and nuts, after a few good swirls in the glass this wine reveals a wealth of brûléed lemon and peach tones. While broad in feel, the flavors are tight and restrained at the moment, centered around zesty citrus and tangy minerals. Drink after 2019.

title: Bellwether 2016 A&D Vineyard Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: This is the last vintage ever from this vineyard on Keuka Lake, which has since been leveled and sold to a real estate developer. Initially restrained on the nose, after a few swirls in the glass this opens up to notes of pollen-dusted chamomile, melon rind and wet slate. A delicately framed palate boasts flavors of tangy white cherry and crunchy green pear, with a slick, silky feel and a lingering limestone finish.

title: Bergström 2016 Silice Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
description: This new vintage of this signature cuvée has a strong scent of tanned leather, and those tack room flavors mute down the plum and cherry fruit. For some tasters, this is a feature, if not a benefit; for others, it may be a bit disappointing. Just one bottle was provided and tasted.

title: Bertrand-Delespierre 2012 Saignée des Terres Amoureuses Brut Rosé Premier Cru  (Champagne)
description: The dark color of this rosé results from skin contact. Most Champagnes are turned rosé by adding still red wine. It is a dry style, crisp and fruity with a zingy texture and plenty of red-currant acidity. Drink now.
designation: Saignée des Terres Amoureuses Brut Rosé Premier Cru
